famous quote:
"We meet no ordinary people in our lives."
-- C.S. Lewis
Interview Text:
A couple years ago, a friend named Stephanie who was raising money for her Special Olympics started making blankets. They were like $40 for a small blanket so I told her it was a little too steep for me. But I still wanted to find a way to help her.

Also about that time we had what many in Atlanta called Snowmageddon. People got snowed in for days all over the city. I had to sleep at work one night. But when I finally emerged I was driving around and saw a man looking super cold at a bus stop, while none of the busses were running yet. So I stopped and we tried to find a shelter together. We got him a really sketchy hotel, but it was cheap and available. 

Anyway, I realized that even in "Hotlanta" the homeless get cold, especially that season. And then I remembered my friend Stephanie's blankets. I made a deal to buy bulk from her at a cheaper price and give the blankets to the homeless.

I think that one was a success. You never know with being creative. At least I stepped out as best as I knew how to and I can say I tried. 

-Raw Spoon (from Miracles in America)
Pursuing Mission text:
"Clearly, the advice of making our happiness the primary aim of our work isn't working. For the Christian, this shouldn't come as a surprise. Why? Because this advice is out of line with Jesus's example to serve rather than be served."
